column2: The Assurance & Advisory Associate is part of a global team conducting value-added audits around the world.          Travel as needed 25-30% of the time, mostly Europe, Middle East, and Asia Pacific.          The Assurance & Advisory Associate will work in teams of 3-5 people led by an Assurance & Advisory Senior Associate and is responsible for audit testing procedures including interviews, workpaper documentation and presenting findings.          All Assurance & Advisory Associates must maintain and exhibit the highest standards of ethics, professionalism, integrity, and discipline in all their actions.        This role has been designated as hybrid and will report to Bengaluru Campus.                Responsibilities:                  Audit Cycle:                              Develop working knowledge of the objectives of the various engagements (eg, statutory, and other regulatory requirements, client expectations, types of reports to be rendered) as well as the planned review approach (including the effect of weaknesses in the control environment and other risks for the areas of the review that they personally execute).        Perform reviews, including inquiries and interviews of operations personnel, utilizing established guidelines to analyse the adequacy of internal controls and compliance with corporate standards, policies, and procedures.                    Analyse evidence, reach conclusions, suggest ideas for improved internal controls and operating efficiencies.                    Assist in drafting the audit report which is used to communicate proposed audit issues and recommendations for improvement to the operating personnel and senior management of Trane Technologies.                    Discuss audit findings with operating personnel to verify facts and obtain background information not available in the documentation examined.                    Participate in closing meetings explaining issues relevant to areas reviewed.                    Prepare neat, concise, and accurate working papers.                General:                              Develop knowledge of general business and economic developments and gain understanding of the Company s industry, particularly the risks involved with the review areas the audit staff personally audits.                    High energy environment best suited to individuals with a desire to continuously learn, a focus on ongoing improvements and good attention to detail.                    Understand and gain exposure to all areas of the audit process including risk assessment, planning, internal controls testing, workpaper documentation and reporting.                    Utilize critical thinking to identify recommendations that can impact financial results/strategies.                    Develop adequate technical knowledge in such areas as accounting, audit, information technology, business processes and other areas as required.                  Qualifications:                            Chartered Accountant certification or other similar qualification.                    Minimum 2 years of relevant audit and/or manufacturing accounting experience.                    Advanced skills in MS Excel and Word.                    Knowledge and experience working with Oracle R12, preferred.                    Ability to travel 25-30%, including international travel.            Behavioural Characteristics                            Interact with client personnel and demonstrate a commitment to continually improve client satisfaction.                    Demonstrate and facilitate teamwork by cooperating with seniors and other staff, sharing information, accepting constructive feedback, and accepting additional assignments when appropriate.                    Strong customer service focus, with a drive to ensure that we exceed the expectations of our customers.                    Build a positive rapport with personnel throughout the global organization.                    Demonstrate a high sense of urgency and confidentiality.                    Exhibit a positive attitude and maintain poise under pressure.                    Exhibit self-confidence with an independent mindset and approach.

column2: General Overview  This position is responsible for processing contributions and donations received by Rotary Foundation (India) from Rotarians, clubs and districts in India and assist in handling all matters related to the contributions and maintenance of records of life insurance policies/wills etc. assigned in favor of Rotary Foundation (India) for benefactor recognition. This position will also deal with all related laws and regulations of Government of India (GOI) for receipts, payments, bookkeeping and accounting. Education Bachelors degree in commerce is a must. Proficiency in computers, Tally and MS Office is required. Role & responsibilities   Process and account for all contributions for general giving, grants, benefactors, major donors, term gifts, endowment fund etc. in Rotary Foundation (India) in a timely and accurate manner. Ensure all details related to contributions and receipts in Rotary Foundation (India) comply with Indian GAAP, applicable local laws and Rotary International policies and are uploaded in Oracle within allocated timelines. Processing the TRF contributions of all Fiscal Agents.  Sending 80G Receipts of all Contributions to Donors & 10 BE Certificates. Reconcile bank transactions to receipts passed on a weekly basis for all inbound bank accounts. Send unknown credits aging report to TRF and CDS teams for resolution on a monthly basis. Ensure that all detail of contributions received under Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) are being informed and reported as per the established policies and procedures. Facilitate review of AR transactions, documents and books of accounts during statutory and governmental audits. Provide information for assessments and annual filing as required. Coordinate queries from Rotarians, donors, officers of clubs & districts related to contributions, donations and associated recognition.  Follow-up with the bankers with respect to any reconciliation items pending for clarification. Perform other duties as assigned. Preferred candidate profile   Good knowledge of accounting is essential. Computer literate with knowledge of Microsoft Windows Suite. (Excel Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Visio), accounting software & Tally accounting. Good written and verbal skills in English and Hindi are essential. Ability to understand and speak a local language(s) desired. Commitment to accuracy and attention to details are essential. Ability to manage multiple priorities and work effectively in a team.

column2: Skill required:  Record To Report - Balance Sheet Account Reconciliations Designation:  Record to Report Ops Associate Qualifications: BCom  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.Posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits.The Balance Sheet Reconciliations team focuses on balance sheet analysis which involves evaluating all balance sheet accounts against sub-ledger or other non-general ledger-based source data. column2: The company specializes in the geosynthetics industry. Geosynthetics are synthetic products used in civil engineering applications for various purposes such as reinforcement, drainage, filtration, separation, and erosion control. Here's what the company does: 1. Manufacturing: The company manufactures geosynthetic products which may include geotextiles, geomembranes, geogrids, geocells, and other specialized materials used in civil engineering projects. 2. Pioneering Products: They are pioneers in introducing innovative geosynthetic products to the Indian market, setting high standards for quality and reliability. 3. Certification: Being the first company to be granted a license from the Bureau of Indian Standards, they ensure that their products meet the required standards and specifications. 4. Pond Construction: The company has extensive experience in constructing ponds using geosynthetic materials. These ponds could be for various purposes such as water storage, waste containment, or environmental protection. 5. End-to-End Solutions: They offer comprehensive solutions to their customers' needs, from initial consultation to product selection, installation, and after-sales service. This approach ensures that their clients receive personalized and efficient support throughout their project lifecycle. Summary: Position: Manager Department: Accounts & Finance  Location: Shilaj  Reporting to: Managing Director Overview: We are seeking a dynamic and proactive Manager for our Accounts & Finance department. The Manager will oversee all financial operations, provide strategic guidance, and ensure financial stability and growth. This role is crucial for driving financial performance, implementing strategies, and optimizing processes within the company. Key Responsibilities: Cost Management & Control Inventory Management Accounts Management Financial Management & Analysis Statutory Compliance Management Audit Management Asset Management Administration MIS Reporting Requirements: Education: Chartered Accountant Experience: Minimum 10 years in a mid-sized listed company Skills: Strong understanding of accounting principles, financial analysis, and taxation. Proven experience in financial planning, budgeting, and reporting. Excellent communication, problem-solving, and leadership skills. Proficiency in Accounts Software (Tally, ERP) and MS Excel. This role requires a qualified and experienced individual capable of leading the finance department effectively, driving financial performance, and contributing to the company's success. If interested please send your resumes on

column1: Process Associate- Finance and Administration Delivery
column2: The Finance & Admin Business Analyst is essential to the ongoing profitable operations for one of the most globally recognized and respected companies in the world. By overseeing our financial activities, you will enable IBM to continue to bring to market ground-breaking innovations such as Artificial Intelligence, Cognitive Solutions, Cloud Infrastructure, and Blockchain technologies, to name a few. Your Role and Responsibilities As Delivery Practitioner, you are responsible for transaction processing in Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable. If you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative workplace, IBM provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every single day. And if you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here. Responsibilities Co-ordinate all accounting activities associated with the General Ledger particularly fixed assets, inter-company, inventory, cash and bank, indirect tax and accruals. Identify risks or opportunities to revenues, cost and profitability and propose appropriate actions. Ensure client Service Level Agreements (SLA) and timelines are met. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Minimum 0-1 year work experience in Finance and Accounting Ability to manage order fulfilment, Collecting and applying Cash payments Experience to identify duplicate records in the Vendor Invoice receipt, verify and process the invoice accurately and in timely manner Knowledge to match Invoices and identify errors and resolve exceptions, prioritize invoices and reduce aging of invoice Be part of a team that are Compliant to SOX- e.g. documents to be posted after due Approval Experience in handling manual and automatic payment requests along with verification and payment run proposal Solid understanding of Process Travel and Expense (T/E) claims and payments, duplicate payment resolution, recovery and vendor statement reconciliations Ability to handle queries through calls and Email follow-ups Working knowledge of basic accounting and various accounting principles. Ability to detect duplicate and or error records and take appropriate actions Proficient in expense management Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and familiar with Accounting terminologies Experience in handling queries via calls and emails is highly desired Comprehend and process data, handle order fulfilment, collect and apply cash payments Follows procedures, comfortable in adapting to transformation within business unit You love collaborative environments that use agile methodologies to encourage creative design thinking and find innovative ways to develop with cutting edge marketing trends Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals. Ability to manage change and be open to it good time management and an ability to work under stress Proven interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Maintain technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications

column1: Order To Cash Operations Associate - Order To Cash Processing
column2: Skill required:Order to Cash Processing - Accounts Receivable Ledger Maintenance  Designation:Management Level - Associate  Job Location:Bengaluru  Qualifications:BBA/BCom/MCom/Master of Business Administration/B.B.M  Years of Experience:1 to 3 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The Order to Cash Processing team provides services to clients and organizations by helping them in the areas of optimizing working capital, providing real-time visibility and end-to-end management of revenue and cash flow, and streamlining billing processes. This team over looks the entire processes that starts from customers inquiry, sales order to delivery and invoicing. In Accounts Receivable Ledger Maintenance you will need to investigate, resolve and troubleshoot unidentified and unapplied cash item and match debit and credit transactions. You should be able to identify items which need month end accrual. Prepare reversing journal entries for the purpose of month end accrual. You should be able to review integrity reports between AP Sub Ledger and GL Controls Accounts  What are we looking for? Accounts Receivable Ledger Maintenance  Customer service - Inbound  Customer service - Outbound  Problem-solving skills  Commitment to quality  Ability to meet deadlines  Ability to perform under pressure  Salesforce Administration  Collections Processing Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines  Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor  You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments  The decisions that you make would impact your own work  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.Posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits.The Financial Consolidation & Close Operations team is responsible for general ledger processes including year-end closing, journalizing, etc. They help create & maintain ledgers, currencies, budgets, & journal entries, deliver solutions including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry & reporting, dynamic allocations & the management of commitments & expenditures, run interface reports & perform close books of accounts. The team reviews P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports. They also work on posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, investigating and reporting open items, reviewing entries and reconciliations, supporting month-end closing, preparing various reports as required, and supporting audits. The team also oversees improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls. What are we looking for? column1: Record To Report Ops Associate - Record To Report
column2: Skill required:Record To Report - Journal Entry Processing  Designation:Management Level - Associate  Qualifications:BCom/MCom/Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience:1 to 3 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The Record to Report team helps clients and organizations in their operational efficiency and balance sheet integrity, cuts time to close and safeguards compliance with regulatory requirements. The areas where this team's expertise lies is in posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits. In Journal Entry Processing, you will be responsible for delivering a financial management solution including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry and reporting as well as dynamic allocations and the management of commitments and expenditures.  What are we looking for? Ability to perform under pressure  Adaptable and flexible  Agility for quick learning  Ability to work well in a team  Detail orientation Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines  Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor  You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments  The decisions that you make would impact your own work  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Sol-Millennium is seeking an experienced    SAP Business One Financial Expert    to lead global Business One module implementation        This role will work closely with regional finance teams and other SAP end-users throughout the company      As the product expert, this person will get to set and lead strategic process improvement, innovation and optimization, and training and support        This is a remote role based in India      Work hours may vary based on the business needs of our global organization                   Responsibilities:                  Implement SAP Business One Financial module, ensuring it aligns with the organizations financial requirements and industry best practices.              Analyze existing financial processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement and recommend solutions that leverage the capabilities of SAP Business One.              Configure and customize the SAP Business One Financial module to meet specific business requirements, including account setup, financial reporting, budgeting, cash flow management, and taxation.              Provide end-user training and support on SAP Business One Financial functionalities.              Collaborate with technical teams to ensure smooth integration of SAP Business One Financial module with other systems or applications. Oversee data migration processes to ensure accurate and timely transfer of financial data into the new system.              Develop and design comprehensive financial reports using SAP Business Ones reporting tools. Analyze financial data and provide insights to support strategic decision-making and drive business performance.              Ensure compliance with relevant financial regulations, accounting standards, and internal controls through the implementation of appropriate processes and system configurations.              Prepare and maintain documentation related to system configurations, processes, and procedures. Keep documentation up to date with any changes or enhancements made to the SAP Business One Financial module.                      Required Qualifications:                  5+ years of total financial experience              At least 3 years of in-depth SAP B1 experience, including general ledger, accounts payable and receivable, banking, fixed assets, and financial reporting.              Bachelors degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.              Strong understanding of financial accounting principles, processes, and best practices.              Proven ability to communicate with and collaborate with cross-functional teams and effectively train end-users.                      Preferred Qualifications:                  Relevant certifications such as SAP Business One Application Associate.              Experience working in the manufacturing and/or healthcare industry.              Understanding of SQL.

column2: The Accounts Executive is responsible for overseeing and managing financial records, preparing financial reports, and ensuring accurate and timely financial transactions for the organization. This role involves working closely with the finance team, handling various accounting tasks, and supervising junior accounting staff. The Accounts Executive/Supervisor reports to the Finance Manager or Chief Financial Officer and plays a key role in maintaining the financial health of the company.       Responsibilities:       Financial Record Keeping:       Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using accounting software.   Record financial transactions, including purchases, sales, receipts, and payments.   Reconcile financial discrepancies by collecting and analyzing account information.       Financial Reporting:       Prepare financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.   Generate financial reports on a regular basis for management review.   Assist in the preparation of budgets and financial forecasts.       Accounts Payable and Receivable:       Process invoices, verify receipts, and manage accounts payable.   Prepare and send out invoices to customers and clients.   Follow up on outstanding payments and manage accounts receivable.       Bank Reconciliation:       Reconcile bank statements and resolve any discrepancies.   Monitor cash flow and manage banking relationships.       Compliance and Regulations:       Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal financial regulations.   Stay updated with accounting principles and industry standards.       Supervision and Team Management:       Supervise and mentor junior accounting staff.   Provide training and support to team members.   Review and approve the work of subordinates.       Financial Analysis:       Analyze financial data and trends to provide insights and recommendations.   Assist in financial planning and decision-making processes.       Audit and Taxation:       Assist in the preparation for internal and external audits.   Coordinate with external auditors and tax consultants as needed.       Process Improvement:       Identify inefficiencies and recommend process improvements.   Streamline accounting processes for increased accuracy and efficiency.
column11: financial analysis, accounts receivable, accounts payable, balance sheet, cash flow statement, team management, bank reconciliation statement, invoice processing, accounting, accounting software, reconciliation, bank reconciliation, income tax, taxation

Bank Reconciliation: Assist in reconciling bank statements with the general ledger, identifying discrepancies, and resolving issues promptly.   5. Month-end Procedures: Participate in month-end closing activities, including preparing journal entries, reconciling accounts, and assisting with financial reporting tasks.   6. Financial Analysis Assistance: Provide support in financial analysis activities, such as variance analysis and trend monitoring, to help inform decision-making processes.   7. Audit Preparation: Assist in preparing audit schedules, gathering supporting documents, and addressing auditor inquiries to facilitate a smooth audit process.   8. Compliance and Documentation: Ensure compliance with company accounting policies and procedures, and assist in maintaining documentation for internal and external reporting requirements.     Required Qualifications/Skills     1. Bachelor s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.   2. Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and record-keeping.    3. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other accounting software applications.    4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.   5. Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively to meet deadlines.   6. Eagerness to learn and a proactive attitude towards problem-solving.   7. Basic understanding of accounting principles and concepts.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Invoice Processing:  Review   and verify invoices for accuracy, completeness, and authorization. Accounting   of invoices with appropriate general ledger accounts and cost centers. Payment Processing:  Advice   and process payments, which may include checks, electronic transfers, and   wire transfers.  Vendor Relations:  Communicate   with concerned SPOC and resolve invoice discrepancies and issues. Respond to   vendor inquiries regarding payment status and discrepancies. Employee Reimbursements:  Review and process employee expense reports, ensuring compliance   with company policies. Vendor Account Reconciliation:  Do a periodic reconciliation of Accounts with Vendors and   maintain the accuracy and completeness of the records. Month-End Closing:    Assist in the month-end closing process by preparing Provisions and   reconciling accounts payable balances. Record Keeping:  Ensure   compliance with company policies and accounting standards. Maintain accurate and organized accounts payable   records and documentation. Fixed Asset Management:  Record and document the procurement of new fixed assets. Calculate and record asset depreciation according to   applicable accounting standards. Perform Annual physical audits as per company policy   to verify the existence and condition of assets. Oversee the disposal of   obsolete or Scrap assets, including proper documentation and recording of   disposal transactions, and calculate the gain/loss on disposals. Bank Statement Reconciliation : Reconcile bank statements with the company's books on a weekly   basis. Review all the bank debits and resolve discrepancies if any. Update   the weekly Cashflows. Statutory Compliance:    Working knowledge of compliance (TDS, Softex, GST, etc), payroll-related   compliances (Income Tax/PF/PT/ESI). Accounts Receivable:    Should understand the base contracts, raise invoices, review with respective   stakeholders, and submit them to clients accurately.  Strong understanding of accounting principles and   practices. Proficiency in Tally Prime Accounting Software and   Microsoft Excel. Attention to detail and accuracy. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Knowledge of Income Tax provisions, individual   taxation, Employee Provident Fund, and Professional Tax.

column2: The Finance Executive plays a crucial role in overseeing and managing financial activities within an organization      This role involves financial analysis, budgeting, financial reporting, and supporting strategic decision-making      The Finance Executive collaborates with cross-functional teams, provides financial insights, ensures compliance with regulations, and contributes to the overall financial health of the organization          Responsibilities:          Financial Planning and Analysis:Assist in the development and implementation of financial plans, budgets, and forecasts      Conduct financial analysis, including variance analysis, trend analysis, and key performance indicators (KPIs), to support decision-making      Monitor and analyze financial data, identifying areas for improvement and cost-saving opportunities      Collaborate with other departments to gather financial information and provide insights for business planning and strategy      Financial Reporting and Compliance:Prepare and review financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements      Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting, adhering to accounting principles and regulatory requirements      Monitor compliance with internal controls, policies, and procedures      Support external audits and coordinate with auditors to provide necessary financial information      Budgeting and Cost Management:Assist in the preparation and monitoring of budgets, providing analysis and recommendations to optimize resource allocation      Monitor and control expenses, identifying cost-saving measures and efficiency improvements      Track and analyze budget variances, providing explanations and recommendations for corrective actions      Cash Flow Management:Monitor and manage cash flow, ensuring sufficient liquidity for operational needs and financial obligations      Prepare cash flow forecasts and projections, identifying potential cash flow gaps or surpluses      Manage working capital, including accounts receivable and accounts payable, optimizing cash flow cycles      Financial Systems and Processes:Contribute to the development and improvement of financial systems, processes, and controls      Implement and maintain financial software and tools to support efficient financial operations      Identify opportunities for automation and streamlining of financial processes      Financial Risk Management:Identify financial risks and develop risk mitigation strategies      Monitor and manage financial risks, including credit risk, liquidity risk, and market risk      Develop and implement internal controls to safeguard assets and ensure compliance with regulations      Stakeholder Communication and Relationship Management:Collaborate with internal stakeholders, such as management, department heads, and business partners, to provide financial insights and support decision-making      Present financial analysis, reports, and recommendations to stakeholders, including senior management and the board of directors      Foster effective relationships with external stakeholders, such as banks, auditors, and regulatory bodies      Continuous Improvement:Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and regulatory changes in finance      Continuously evaluate and improve financial processes, systems, and controls      Identify opportunities for process automation, efficiency gains, and cost savings          Qualifications:          Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field      Professional certifications such as CPA (Certified Public Accountant) or CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) are desirable      Proven experience in finance roles, with a focus on financial analysis, financial reporting, or financial planning and analysis      Strong understanding of financial principles, accounting standards, and financial regulations      Proficiency in financial analysis techniques, financial modeling, and budgeting      Advanced skills in MS Excel and financial software applications      Knowledge of financial systems and tools such as ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems      Familiarity with financial risk management and internal control frameworks      Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail      Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex financial information to non-financial stakeholder

column2: As an Executive in Finance, you play a crucial role in managing financial activities and providing strategic financial guidance to support the organization's goals and objectives      Your responsibilities may vary depending on the size and nature of the organization, but here are some common tasks associated with this role:Financial Planning and Analysis: You contribute to the development of financial plans, budgets, and forecasts      You analyze financial data, identify trends, and provide insights to support strategic decision-making      You work closely with other departments to gather inputs for financial planning and ensure alignment with organizational goals      Financial Reporting: You prepare and present financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, and variance analysis      You ensure compliance with accounting principles, regulatory requirements, and internal policies      You may also be responsible for preparing financial statements for external stakeholders, such as shareholders, investors, or auditors      Budgeting and Cost Control: You collaborate with department managers to develop and manage budgets      You monitor actual spending against budgeted amounts and analyze variances      You identify cost-saving opportunities and implement measures to control expenses without compromising operational efficiency      Cash Flow Management: You oversee cash flow operations, including monitoring cash inflows and outflows, optimizing working capital, and managing liquidity      You forecast cash flow requirements, assess funding needs, and coordinate with treasury or banking partners to ensure sufficient funds are available for business operations      Financial Compliance: You ensure compliance with financial regulations, accounting standards, and tax requirements      You maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records and coordinate with internal and external auditors for periodic audits      You also provide support during tax filings and address any compliance issues that may arise      Financial Systems and Processes: You contribute to the development and improvement of financial systems, processes, and controls      You may assist in implementing or upgrading financial management software, such as ERP systems, to enhance efficiency and accuracy in financial operations      Financial Analysis and Decision Support: You perform financial analysis, conduct profitability assessments, and evaluate investment opportunities or business initiatives      You provide financial insights and recommendations to support strategic planning, pricing decisions, and resource allocation

Determining financials by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions  Process JE's, Bank upload journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliationsResponsible for general ledger processes including Monthly, quarterly, half yearly and year-end closing, journalizing, etc.  Intercompany Account Reconciliation which involves recording & reconciliation of transactions, also includes assuring that transactional relationships between the entities are in balance. Performing Netting and settlement process.  Review P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports.Identify improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls. What are we looking for? Qualifications: Minimum 3 6 years of Record to Report experience in Finance & Accounting function  BPO experience will be an added advantage but not mandatory.  Minimum Bachelor's degree in Finance Accounting or MBA FinannceSystem & applications Experience working in SAP ERP,Blackline & Other Technologies would be preferred and added advantage. Sound knowledge of MS Excel & word. Having advanced Excel knowledge would be an added advantage.Communication & Interpersonal skills Ability to interact with customers for daily operational activities with client SME Excellent in communication skills both oral and written as needed to interact with customers/internal stakeholders via calls and e-mails. Closely work with team lead to drive process/organizational initiative  Must be able to communicate both orally and in writing with client Reconciliations SME and 3rdparties involved and can raise timely and accurate queries  Roles and Responsibilities:  Understanding of various account reconciliations (Bank / Balance sheet / GL account/Store accounts) on a frequency level of daily/weekly/monthly  Perform variance analysis and provide reason codes for open items Perform month end closing as per the agreed schedule Work on open items resolutions received, raise appropriate queries if required to clients and 3rdparties Prepare and post journals with prior approvals from clients/team leads Achieve 100% accuracy & productivity for activities in scope. Perform quality check for reconciliation, queries raised to the client or 3rd parties and share the results with SME. Interact with client SMEs, Lead for daily work and process related issues and work on open items resolutions received, raise appropriate queries if required to clients and 3rd parties Must possess good communication skills both e-mail and oral Generate lean ideas and provide inputs to process leads for improvement opportunities. Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Skill required:  Property & Casualty- Underwriting - Underwriting Designation:  Underwriting Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? The selected persons should be willing to perform such projects / tasks which provides them an overview of the work in the General Accounting services area for retail business. Identified individuals should understand the client business, technology, process details and procedures. This role consist of recording, monitoring and reporting Asset Acquisition / Creation, Transfer/ Retirement/ Impairment, Depreciation and completing all month end activities including Reconciliations. You will be responsible for monitoring projects in Fixed assets Capital WIP account and ensuring appropriate accounting treatment at period close. You will process requests for transfer / retirement / disposal of fixed assets, and support documentation of asset inventory checks. You will execute the monthly depreciation run and necessary entries. You will also complete all month end activities, including reconciliations and reporting as required. You will support the company goals by focusing on personal accountability, customer service and work efficiency. Resource will also be responsible for managing delivery teams. What are we looking for? Commerce Graduate/Chartered Accountant/ICWA/CS with 6 - 7 years of experience in Fixed Assets Accounting  Candidate must possess strong written and verbal communication skills, be well organized, detail oriented, and have the ability to perform in a fast-paced changing environment Experience working with accounting applications preferred; PDI, AS400, JDE, SAP, Recon Net, Blackline, Service-now Fair understanding and experience of executing / leading process transformation actions Bachelor's / Master degree in accounting  6+ years of accounting experience in Fixed Assets Must be computer literate in MS Excel and Access. Ability to organize and prioritize detailed information. Strong written and verbal communication skills required to effectively work with other departments. Experience working with ERP applications is a plus.  Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role, you are required to fulfil below responsibilities: -  Record fixed asset acquisitions and dispositions in the Fixed Asset System (FAS) Track the compilation of projects costs in Purchase Order/Project Accounting (POPA) system into the FAS system when projects have been completed Prepare project entries as needed to ensure correct recording of invoices. Assist with the set-up of assets. Reconcile the account balances in FAS subsidiary ledger to the Property, Plant, and Equipment (PP&E) General Ledger accounts Complete depreciation and economic penalty analysis on asset additions Run depreciation calculation in FAS for all fixed assets and prepare journal entries Support Tax Department with fixed asset data requests. Responsible for ensuring store asset audits are performed every 5 years. Prepares financial reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing account information and trends. Documents financial transactions by entering account information, while substantiating these transactions by auditing documents when needed Ensures compliance with requirements, policies and regulations by enforcing adherence to corporate controls and policies. Maintains financial security by ensuring that internal controls and SOX controls are being followed Adhere to Company and department policies and procedures Promptly and effectively communicating with both internal and external stakeholders Assisting Record to Report Manager in any other RTR/FA related tasks and projects Ability to comprehend basic statistics and terms involved in the day-to-day business and using the same during process discussions. Identification of process improvement / lean ideas to avoid measurable, repeatable, predictable and transaction processing efforts Constantly be on the lookout for ways to enhance value for your respective stakeholders/clients Ensure that the SLAs and Operations metrics are met Guide, support, and work with other team leaders & team members  Prepare management reports for clients and internal management Share feedbacks and execute performance management actions Execution of backup planning for all service delivery actions Facilitate quality checks for the work performed by the team members Participation in performance review/governance discussions with client Managing small / mid size teams (5-15 FTE) Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Skill required:  Record To Report - Journal Entry Processing Designation:  Record to Report Ops Analyst Qualifications: BCom  Years of Experience: 3 to 5 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.Posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits.In Journal Entry Processing, you will be responsible for delivering a financial management solution including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry and reporting as well as dynamic allocations and the management of commitments and expenditures. What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible Ability to perform under pressure Problem-solving skills Results orientation  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BCom

column2: Managing Accounts Payables cycle from receipt of invoices to payments including documentation.      Vendor Management - Creating vendors in Oracle and respond to Vendor inquiries wherever required as per company policies.      Invoice/Payment Processing- Enter and/or upload invoices into ERP system. Maintain copies of vouchers, invoices or correspondence necessary for documentation. Responsible for payment Accounting and necessary documentation. Obtain proper information and/or data regarding invoice payments.      Reconciliation- Identify and resolve invoice discrepancies and issues. Reconciling processed work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balances. Reconciliation of Vendor Accounts.      Compliance - Ensure all accounts payables policies, procedures and authority matrix are adhered including employees travel and related expenses. Flag and clarify any unusual or questionable invoices. Managing to get the information and approvals from operations Ex: Related to cash transactions or any invoice in case of query.      Maintaining confidentiality of organizational information.      Provide supporting documentation for audits. 1 to 3 years of experience      Expertise in AP/AR process; Knowledge on 3 way/2 way match and accounting of invoices.      Should have Sound Knowledge of excel & other MS Office applications      Experience in Oracle ERP will be preferable      Proficiency in the use of Microsoft (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) is required.      Excellent customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills      Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize multiple on-going projects.      Bachelors or Masters degree in Commerce.

column2: Artech India is looking for Executive - Finance to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     The Finance Executive plays a crucial role in overseeing and managing financial activities within an organization     This role involves financial analysis, budgeting, financial reporting, and supporting strategic decision-making     The Finance Executive collaborates with cross-functional teams, provides financial insights, ensures compliance with regulations, and contributes to the overall financial health of the organization       Responsibilities:       Financial Planning and Analysis:Assist in the development and implementation of financial plans, budgets, and forecasts     Conduct financial analysis, including variance analysis, trend analysis, and key performance indicators (KPIs), to support decision-making     Monitor and analyze financial data, identifying areas for improvement and cost-saving opportunities     Collaborate with other departments to gather financial information and provide insights for business planning and strategy     Financial Reporting and Compliance:Prepare and review financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements     Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting, adhering to accounting principles and regulatory requirements     Monitor compliance with internal controls, policies, and procedures     Support external audits and coordinate with auditors to provide necessary financial information     Budgeting and Cost Management:Assist in the preparation and monitoring of budgets, providing analysis and recommendations to optimize resource allocation     Monitor and control expenses, identifying cost-saving measures and efficiency improvements     Track and analyze budget variances, providing explanations and recommendations for corrective actions     Cash Flow Management:Monitor and manage cash flow, ensuring sufficient liquidity for operational needs and financial obligations     Prepare cash flow forecasts and projections, identifying potential cash flow gaps or surpluses     Manage working capital, including accounts receivable and accounts payable, optimizing cash flow cycles     Financial Systems and Processes:Contribute to the development and improvement of financial systems, processes, and controls     Implement and maintain financial software and tools to support efficient financial operations     Identify opportunities for automation and streamlining of financial processes     Financial Risk Management:Identify financial risks and develop risk mitigation strategies     Monitor and manage financial risks, including credit risk, liquidity risk, and market risk     Develop and implement internal controls to safeguard assets and ensure compliance with regulations     Stakeholder Communication and Relationship Management:Collaborate with internal stakeholders, such as management, department heads, and business partners, to provide financial insights and support decision-making     Present financial analysis, reports, and recommendations to stakeholders, including senior management and the board of directors     Foster effective relationships with external stakeholders, such as banks, auditors, and regulatory bodies     Continuous Improvement:Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and regulatory changes in finance     Continuously evaluate and improve financial processes, systems, and controls     Identify opportunities for process automation, efficiency gains, and cost savings       Qualifications:       Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field     Professional certifications such as CPA (Certified Public Accountant) or CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) are desirable     Proven experience in finance roles, with a focus on financial analysis, financial reporting, or financial planning and analysis     Strong understanding of financial principles, accounting standards, and financial regulations     Proficiency in financial analysis techniques, financial modeling, and budgeting     Advanced skills in MS Excel and financial software applications     Knowledge of financial systems and tools such as ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems     Familiarity with financial risk management and internal control frameworks     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail     Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders

column1: Hiring - Senior Executive Finance with 5 To 7 years of experience
column2: The role includes financial responsibilities & tasks, meticulous oversight & management of daily transactions, bank reconciliations, corporate banking activities, General Ledger accuracy, monthly book closure & MIS, managing stakeholders relations, ensuring compliance with tax obligations including TDS and GST filings & annual returns, asset management and assistance with tax assessments. The role also involves supporting audit processes, managing foreign transactions and demonstrating an independent work ethic - to ensure the maintenance taining of financial health and compliance of the company.  Daily Financial Oversight: Rigorous monitoring of day-to-day transactions, ensuring all vouchers are thoroughly verified for accuracy. Bank Reconciliation: Diligently matching bank entries in Tally with bank statements to maintain financial integrity. Corporate Banking: Handling all banking transactions for the company, ensuring financial operations run smoothly. General Ledger (GL) Management: Prompt verification and immediate rectification of any discrepancies in the GL to uphold accounting standards. Vendor Management: Systematic maintenance of the Vendor Master database and timely processing of vendor payments. Tax Compliance: Ensuring punctual payments and filing of Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) returns, adhering to statutory deadlines. Tax Assessment Assistance: Assisting in handling income tax assessments, providing support and documentation as needed. GST Filing & Reconciliation: Accurate and timely submission of GST returns, including GSTR1 and GSTR-3B, to comply with tax regulations, monthly reconciliation of GSTR2A/2B, cross-verifying input tax credits with supplier declarations, filing of annual returns, including GSTR-9 & 9C, ensuring compliance with GST regulations. Audit Support: Providing comprehensive information and support to both internal and statutory auditors during audit processes. Foreign Transactions: Managing import payments and resolving any issues with the Import Data Processing and Monitoring System (IDPMS) and Export Data Processing and Monitoring System (EDPMS) efficiently. Independent Work Ethic: Demonstrating the ability to work independently, taking initiative and responsibility for tasks, timely closure and driving outcomes. Asset Management: Overseeing fixed assets control and management, ensuring accurate tracking and valuation of company assets.

column2: As an Executive in Finance, you play a crucial role in managing financial activities and providing strategic financial guidance to support the organization's goals and objectives       Your responsibilities may vary depending on the size and nature of the organization, but here are some common tasks associated with this role:       Financial Planning and Analysis: You contribute to the development of financial plans, budgets, and forecasts     You analyze financial data, identify trends, and provide insights to support strategic decision-making     You work closely with other departments to gather inputs for financial planning and ensure alignment with organizational goals     Financial Reporting: You prepare and present financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, and variance analysis     You ensure compliance with accounting principles, regulatory requirements, and internal policies     You may also be responsible for preparing financial statements for external stakeholders, such as shareholders, investors, or auditors     Budgeting and Cost Control: You collaborate with department managers to develop and manage budgets     You monitor actual spending against budgeted amounts and analyze variances     You identify cost-saving opportunities and implement measures to control expenses without compromising operational efficiency     Cash Flow Management: You oversee cash flow operations, including monitoring cash inflows and outflows, optimizing working capital, and managing liquidity     You forecast cash flow requirements, assess funding needs, and coordinate with treasury or banking partners to ensure sufficient funds are available for business operations     Financial Compliance: You ensure compliance with financial regulations, accounting standards, and tax requirements     You maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records and coordinate with internal and external auditors for periodic audits     You also provide support during tax filings and address any compliance issues that may arise     Financial Systems and Processes: You contribute to the development and improvement of financial systems, processes, and controls     You may assist in implementing or upgrading financial management software, such as ERP systems, to enhance efficiency and accuracy in financial operations     Financial Analysis and Decision Support: You perform financial analysis, conduct profitability assessments, and evaluate investment opportunities or business initiatives     You provide financial insights and recommendations to support strategic planning, pricing decisions, and resource allocation

column2: The Finance Executive plays a crucial role in overseeing and managing financial activities within an organization     This role involves financial analysis, budgeting, financial reporting, and supporting strategic decision-making     The Finance Executive collaborates with cross-functional teams, provides financial insights, ensures compliance with regulations, and contributes to the overall financial health of the organization     Responsibilities:Financial Planning and Analysis:Assist in the development and implementation of financial plans, budgets, and forecasts     Conduct financial analysis, including variance analysis, trend analysis, and key performance indicators (KPIs), to support decision-making     Monitor and analyze financial data, identifying areas for improvement and cost-saving opportunities     Collaborate with other departments to gather financial information and provide insights for business planning and strategy     Financial Reporting and Compliance:Prepare and review financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements     Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting, adhering to accounting principles and regulatory requirements     Monitor compliance with internal controls, policies, and procedures     Support external audits and coordinate with auditors to provide necessary financial information     Budgeting and Cost Management:Assist in the preparation and monitoring of budgets, providing analysis and recommendations to optimize resource allocation     Monitor and control expenses, identifying cost-saving measures and efficiency improvements     Track and analyze budget variances, providing explanations and recommendations for corrective actions     Cash Flow Management:Monitor and manage cash flow, ensuring sufficient liquidity for operational needs and financial obligations     Prepare cash flow forecasts and projections, identifying potential cash flow gaps or surpluses     Manage working capital, including accounts receivable and accounts payable, optimizing cash flow cycles     Financial Systems and Processes:Contribute to the development and improvement of financial systems, processes, and controls     Implement and maintain financial software and tools to support efficient financial operations     Identify opportunities for automation and streamlining of financial processes     Financial Risk Management:Identify financial risks and develop risk mitigation strategies     Monitor and manage financial risks, including credit risk, liquidity risk, and market risk     Develop and implement internal controls to safeguard assets and ensure compliance with regulations     Stakeholder Communication and Relationship Management:Collaborate with internal stakeholders, such as management, department heads, and business partners, to provide financial insights and support decision-making     Present financial analysis, reports, and recommendations to stakeholders, including senior management and the board of directors     Foster effective relationships with external stakeholders, such as banks, auditors, and regulatory bodies     Continuous Improvement:Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and regulatory changes in finance     Continuously evaluate and improve financial processes, systems, and controls     Identify opportunities for process automation, efficiency gains, and cost savings     Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field     Professional certifications such as CPA (Certified Public Accountant) or CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) are desirable     Proven experience in finance roles, with a focus on financial analysis, financial reporting, or financial planning and analysis     Strong understanding of financial principles, accounting standards, and financial regulations     Proficiency in financial analysis techniques, financial modeling, and budgeting     Advanced skills in MS Excel and financial software applications     Knowledge of financial systems and tools such as ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems     Familiarity with financial risk management and internal control frameworks     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail     Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders       ?

column2: As an Executive in Finance, you play a crucial role in managing financial activities and providing strategic financial guidance to support the organization's goals and objectives        Your responsibilities may vary depending on the size and nature of the organization, but here are some common tasks associated with this role:        Financial Planning and Analysis: You contribute to the development of financial plans, budgets, and forecasts      You analyze financial data, identify trends, and provide insights to support strategic decision-making      You work closely with other departments to gather inputs for financial planning and ensure alignment with organizational goals      Financial Reporting: You prepare and present financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, and variance analysis      You ensure compliance with accounting principles, regulatory requirements, and internal policies      You may also be responsible for preparing financial statements for external stakeholders, such as shareholders, investors, or auditors      Budgeting and Cost Control: You collaborate with department managers to develop and manage budgets      You monitor actual spending against budgeted amounts and analyze variances      You identify cost-saving opportunities and implement measures to control expenses without compromising operational efficiency      Cash Flow Management: You oversee cash flow operations, including monitoring cash inflows and outflows, optimizing working capital, and managing liquidity      You forecast cash flow requirements, assess funding needs, and coordinate with treasury or banking partners to ensure sufficient funds are available for business operations      Financial Compliance: You ensure compliance with financial regulations, accounting standards, and tax requirements      You maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records and coordinate with internal and external auditors for periodic audits      You also provide support during tax filings and address any compliance issues that may arise      Financial Systems and Processes: You contribute to the development and improvement of financial systems, processes, and controls      You may assist in implementing or upgrading financial management software, such as ERP systems, to enhance efficiency and accuracy in financial operations      Financial Analysis and Decision Support: You perform financial analysis, conduct profitability assessments, and evaluate investment opportunities or business initiatives      You provide financial insights and recommendations to support strategic planning, pricing decisions, and resource allocation

column2: The role of a Senior Accountant Executive requires a combination of technical accounting expertise, management skills, and strategic insight. Here are some key skills essential for this position: Accounting and Financial Reporting: Proficiency in accounting principles and practices (GAAP, IFRS). Experience with financial reporting, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements. Ability to prepare accurate and timely financial statements. Financial Analysis: Strong analytical skills to interpret financial data and provide insights. Ability to conduct variance analysis, trend analysis, and financial forecasting. Proficiency in budgeting and financial planning. Taxation and Compliance: Knowledge of tax regulations and compliance requirements. Experience in preparing and filing tax returns. Ability to manage audits and ensure adherence to legal standards. Software Proficiency: Expertise in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP, Oracle). Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel for financial modeling and data analysis. Familiarity with ERP systems and other financial management tools. Leadership and Management: Ability to lead and mentor a team of accountants and financial staff. Strong project management skills to oversee financial projects and initiatives. Excellent communication skills for presenting financial information to stakeholders. Problem-Solving and Decision-Making: Strong problem-solving skills to address financial discrepancies and challenges. Ability to make informed decisions based on financial data and business insights. Strategic thinking to align financial goals with organizational objectives. Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy in financial reporting and data analysis. Ability to identify and correct errors in financial documents. Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and deadlines. Ethical Conduct: Commitment to maintaining ethical standards and integrity in financial practices. Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion. Interpersonal Skills: Ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues, clients, and other stakeholders. Strong negotiation skills for managing vendor contracts and financial agreements. Customer service orientation to address client needs and inquiries. Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying updated with industry trends, regulations, and best practices. Willingness to pursue professional development opportunities and certifications (e.g., CPA, CMA). These skills collectively enable a Senior Accountant Executive to manage complex financial operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and contribute to the overall financial health of the organization.

column2: Job Summary :  The candidate will be responsible for managing a wide range of financial activities, with a focus on direct and indirect tax compliance, accounts payable, bank management, and fixed asset management. The candidate will be required to work closely with internal departments and external vendors to ensure compliance with company policies and procedures. Key Responsibilities: Tax Compliance: Working knowledge of TDS and its relevant laws and regulations (includes support on monthly TDS payments, quarterly TDS returns, relevant statutory and tax audit deliverables, etc.)  Working knowledge of GST and its relevant laws and regulations (includes support on monthly GST returns and payments, annual GST return, maintenance of relevant reconciliation workings, relevant statutory and tax audit deliverables, etc.) Ensure timely and accurate compliance under direct and indirect tax areas. Accounts Management: Process invoices, payments, and receipts. Reconcile accounts and resolve discrepancies. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of payables and receivables. Bank Management: Manage company bank accounts. Reconcile bank statements and resolve discrepancies. Monitor cash flow and optimize the use of funds. Fixed Asset Management: Maintain a detailed register of fixed assets. Track depreciation, impairment, and disposal of fixed assets. Conduct periodic physical verifications of assets. Compliance and Documentation: Ensure adherence to financial policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Maintain accurate financial records and documentation for audits. Complete period-end closing procedures and reports as specified. What we are looking for: Core Competencies Proficiency in financial software and tools (e.g., ERP systems, Excel, SAP). Understanding of indirect and direct tax regulations, compliance and relevant accounting Knowledge of accounts payable processes and best practices. Experience in bank management and understanding of cash flow management. Familiarity with fixed asset accounting and depreciation methods. Working experience in an MNC would be an added advantage. Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Compliance-driven mindset and strong ethics. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Eagerness to learn and adapt to different finance functions. Your Qualifications: Bachelors degree in finance, Accounting, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in finance, accounting, and tax management. Good communication and interpersonal skills.   Why You'll Love Working Here: Being at Cimpress means that you dont see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey ??and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what?? next, we??e always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we??e capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work. Remote First-Culture: In 2020, Cimpress adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most  brilliant self. Cimpress also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in-person working will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 30 US States as well as many countries in Europe: including Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, Ireland and Switzerland.

column2: We are seeking a qualified Inventory Accountant to be based at our global headquarters in Houston, TX       This position offers an exciting opportunity to play a key role in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of inventory data, contributing to the financial health and operational efficiency of the organization                  Key Responsibilities                    Month-End Reconciliations:        Conduct thorough reconciliations of inventory balances between internal records and third-party data sources. Investigate, identify and correct any discrepancies to ensure accuracy.                General Ledger Entries:        Book journal entries as needed to correct inventory balances in the general ledger. Ensure that all adjustments are accurately recorded and compliant with US GAAP.                Collaboration with Operations Team:        Work closely with the operations team to identify and resolve discrepancies and improve inventory management processes. Communicate effectively to address issues and implement solutions in a timely manner.                Product Cost Inquires:        Serve as a subject matter expert for inventory-related questions from various departments, including being able to explain how the ERP system is calculating product cost for deals.                Financial Audits:        Provide supporting documentation and address questions from auditors and banks.                Costs coding:        Provide accurate coding to Invoicing and Banking teams for booking secondary cost invoices and bank charges.                Process Improvements:        Continuously seek opportunities to streamline month-end reconciliation processes and enhance efficiency. Implement best practices to ensure timely and accurate reporting of inventory data.                Compliance and Reporting:        Ensure compliance with accounting principles and regulations governing inventory management. Prepare and present reports on inventory reconciliation findings, highlighting any areas of concern or improvement opportunities.                Problem-Solving:        Proactively identify and address any challenges related to inventory reconciliations and general ledger maintenance. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop effective processes.              Qualifications                  Bachelor s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.              Minimum of 3 years relevant experience preferred.              Proven experience in inventory accounting, month-end reconciliations, and general ledger management preferred.              Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.              Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.              Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.              Must be well organized, able to work effectively and manage multiple priorities to meet deadlines.              Commitment to accuracy, integrity, and continuous improvement.              Experienced in fast-paced, deadline driven environment.              Ability to work extended hours during various times of the month/year.

column2: The Senior Accounts Executive in the pharmaceutical industry plays a vital role in managing financial transactions, reporting, and compliance within the organization. T      his position involves overseeing various accounting functions, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, financial reporting, and budgeting while ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements and company policies.      Additionally, familiarity with SAP (Systems, Applications, and Products in Data Processing) is required to effectively manage financial data and processes within the SAP environment.        Key Responsibilities:        Manage day-to-day accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable,      general ledger entries, and bank reconciliations, to ensure the accuracy and completeness of      Prepare and review financial statements, reports, and analyses, including balance sheets,      income statements, cash flow statements, and variance analysis, to support decision-making      Coordinate and facilitate the month-end and year-end closing processes, ensuring timely and      accurate completion of financial reporting tasks and reconciliations.      Maintain and update accounting policies, procedures, and internal controls to ensure      compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., GAAP, IFRS) and company policies.      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Finance, Procurement, and Operations, to      support financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting activities, and provide financial insights      Monitor accounts receivable aging and collections activities, follow up on overdue accounts,      and coordinate with sales and customer service teams to resolve billing issues and disputes.      Manage vendor relationships, including invoice processing, payment approvals, and vendor      inquiries, to ensure timely and accurate payment processing and maintain positive vendor      Perform periodic reviews and audits of financial transactions, accounts, and processes to      identify discrepancies, risks, and opportunities for process improvement.      Assist in the implementation and maintenance of SAP ERP systems, including configuration,      data migration, user training, and system upgrades, to support efficient financial data      Provide guidance, training, and support to junior accounting staff, ensuring their professional      development and adherence to accounting standards and best practices.        Qualifications and Skills:        Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field required; CPA or relevant      Minimum of 2 years of experience in accounting or finance roles within the pharmaceutical or      healthcare industry, with a strong understanding of pharmaceutical accounting principles and      regulatory requirements.      Proficiency in SAP ERP systems, including SAP Financial Accounting (FI), Controlling (CO), and      Materials Management (MM), with hands-on experience in SAP implementation,      Solid knowledge of financial reporting standards (e.g., GAAP, IFRS) and regulatory compliance      requirements applicable to the pharmaceutical industry.      Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret financial data,      identify trends, and make data-driven recommendations.      Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with      cross-functional teams and communicate financial information to non-finance stakeholders.      Detail-oriented and organized, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet      deadlines in a fast-paced environment.      Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other accounting software applications, with the ability to      create complex spreadsheets, financial models, and analyses.

column2: The Finance & Admin Business Analyst is essential to the ongoing profitable operations for one of the most globally recognized and respected companies in the world. By overseeing our financial activities, you will enable IBM to continue to bring to market ground-breaking innovations such as Artificial Intelligence, Cognitive Solutions, Cloud Infrastructure, and Blockchain technologies, to name a few. Your Role and Responsibilities As Subject Matter Expert (SME)- Procure to Pay (P2P), you are responsible for invoice processing, vendor master management, Query resolution, indexing and Invoice reconciliation.  If you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative workplace, IBM provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every single day. And if you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here. Responsibilities Vendor master creation, changes, verification and cleansing.  Identify the duplicate records for the Vendor Master Maintenance Invoice receipt, verification and processing accurately.  Prioritize processing of urgent/ageing invoices. Recording of Invoices both Purchase Order Based and Non-Purchase Order Based (Un-supported Invoices), Co-ordination with various stakeholders, obtaining coding, approval and resolving issues around blocked invoices. Ensuring payment and expense entries are posted in accounting software on a timely basis. You will have to handle manual and automatic payment requests. Processing of travel and expense claims, payments, duplicate payment resolution and recovery and verify and run payment proposals. Would be involved in handling queries for vendor statement reconciliation through calls and emails. Adhere to client SLA's (Service Level Agreements) and timelines. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Minimum of 4-6 Years of experience in Accounts Payable. Experience in invoice and vendor management along with resolving queries, and Invoice reconciliation.  Proven work knowledge to manage payment reporting and reconciliation activities. Willingness to perform duties in varying shifts. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Proficient in MS office applications  Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals.  Proven change management and be open to it good time management and work under tight deadlines  Proven interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Maintain technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications.
